name: Ramayana Manjari (by Swetha Sunil)
description: Immerse yourself in the epic tale of the Ramayana with 'Ramayana Manjari,' a captivating Bharatanatyam recital by Swetha Sunil. This performance brings the timeless story to life through a curated selection of traditional compositions, including revered Pancharatna Kritis. The recital will navigate through the central themes of the epic, exploring profound emotions of love, longing, and valor, all steeped in the essence of bhakti (devotion). Swetha Sunil will embody various characters and narrate key events from the Ramayana, using the rich vocabulary of Bharatanatyam to convey the story's emotional depth and spiritual significance. This family-friendly performance is designed to be an engaging experience for all, with a runtime of approximately 45 minutes. The event is part of a festival hosted at Medai - The Stage Bengaluru, a venue known for promoting classical arts. The performance offers a unique opportunity to experience one of India's most cherished epics through the grace and power of classical dance, making for a culturally enriching evening for the entire family.

name: Spirit Forward Bar Takeover
description: Lavelle Road’s favorite neighborhood bar is throwing a high-energy 2nd Anniversary Takeover on September 18. The evening kicks off with food from 5 PM, followed by a special guest bar team-up as Hideaway Goa joins forces with the Lost & Found crew from Cyprus to shake up inventive cocktails from 8 PM onwards. With chefs Gresham and Manoj of BandraBorn whipping up signature bites, plus plenty of shots and Don Julio-fueled cheer, it’s set to be a spirited Thursday night triple threat of food, drinks, and revelry.

location.name: Bar Spirit Forward, Ashok Nagar
location.address: Bar Spirit Forward, Ashok Nagar, Bangalore

name: Tadga Raho x Desi Breakfast Club
description:
We’re bringing fitness and flavour together in one power-packed morning!
Join us for a special collaboration between Tagda Raho 
and Treat’s Desi Breakfast Club.

📅 Date
Sunday, 21st September 2025

⏰ Time 
Workout @ Tagda Raho Dugout, Ulsoor: 08:00 AM – 09:30 AM
Breakfast @ Treat, Indiranagar: 10:00 AM onwards

👥 Spots: Limited to 25 participants

Kickstart your Sunday with strength, community, and movement at the dugout, followed by a hearty desi breakfast spread — Chole Bhature, Parathas, Keema Pav, and more.

💥 Tagda raho, aur desi naashta khao!

name: RA.SA Sessions: Vol 1
description: Kavan Kuttappa of Eat Naru and Anurag Arora of The Apartment come together for a candid dialogue on how Bangalore eats, drinks and creates culture

name: Paired Up - Chef Kalyan x SDU Wines
description:
A wine dinner built for meat lovers only. Think bold naati flavours reimagined through a five-course menu, each savoury dish paired to perfection with SDU wines. Chef Kalyan’s taking the lead on the food, and together it’s going to be a pairing you won’t forget.

Course 1
Kothmiri meenu
Coriander-Lemon Grilled seabass, potato chips, Old Bangalore style
SDU Reserva Chardonnay
Course 2
Miriyalu Pitta
Peppered up quail, mini idlis
SDU Reserva Syrah
Course 3
Kaalchina Pandi Maamsam
Grilled pork skewers, akki rottil
SDU Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon
Course 4
Bannur Kuri Chops
Bannur Lamb Chops, Khaima pongal
SDU Wine Maker's Selection
Course 5
Pheni
Pheni, milk, served the Old Bangalore way

name: Kalaripayattu Movement
description:
Hey Sisters,
Get ready to step into the ancient flow of Kalari — a powerful body-mind practice that’s playful, structured, and deeply transformative! This movement art will help you find balance, build flexibility, sharpen focus, and awaken parts of your body you probably haven’t moved in years (or ever!).
Expect to feel strong, grounded, and centered, while tapping into an ancient wisdom that connects body, mind, and spirit. It’s not just fitness — it’s a lifestyle that brings vitality, energy, and inner calm.
Date: 21st September (Sunday)
Time: 10:30 AM- 12:00 PM
Place: Dizzy Duck Studio, Koramangala
Are you ready to move like never before and unleash your power?

name: Pole Workshop With Azdah
description:
POLE WITH AZDAH IS BACK!
Hey Sisters, get ready for your second pole sesh with Azdah! This class is all about learning the fundamentals — fun spins, climbs & a lil’ choreography to tie it all together.
Date: 20th September, Saturday
Time: 2:30- 4:30 PM
Place: Azdah Pole, Indiranagar
Carry:
Short bicycle shorts (above mid-thigh / swimsuit works too — skin contact = grip!)
Water bottle (no disposables at the studio)
No moisturiser 12 hrs before (unless very dry skin, then light moisturiser ~3 hrs before)
An open mind & heart!
Expect:
Friction burns (they’re normal!) Upper body muscles working hard
It might feel tricky at first, but pole is about practice, not perfection!
You’ll be amazed at how much strength & confidence you build in just one class!
See you on the pole Ladies!

name: Supper Clubs Of India: A Coastal Thali
description:
Bengaluru Servd and NIC Ice Creams present: Supper Clubs of India - Bengaluru Edition, a series of intimate dining experiences highlighting regional community-style meals and cuisines from across India!

For our next Supper, Kari Apla, Mumbai is presenting the best of Coastal cuisines with an all-you-can-eat Thali!
They’ve got a hearty meal in store featuring some of their bestsellers such as the Mushroom Pepper Roast, Mutton Lonche, Prawn Caldine and more.

Chefs Ebaani and Mathew created Kari Apla as an ode to their roots, spanning both South Indian and Maharashtrian cultures. The name itself combines Malayalam and Marathi to mean ‘Our Curry’. 
The food reflects the philosophy with flavours and ingredients from across the coast, elevated and in perfect harmony.

For dessert, dive into an indulgent Taadgola Jaggery Cake with Cashew Brittle that will pair perfectly with a surprise ice cream flavour by NIC Ice Creams!

Also sip on cocktails crafted for the thali!

Check out the Menu: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1vugMzQFXy7_EFdgR3gkkerA4ha9HfSP3

Limited seats only. Book yours now!

NOTE: Once tickets are booked, please share your meal preference (Vegetarian or Non-Vegetarian) along with any allergies with us on WhatsApp at 8123265307

name: Mushroom Yoga Brunch | Nuvedo x Maverick & Farmer Coffee with Chef Sejal & Lisha Sinha
description:
The Mushroom Brunch is a collaborative weekend experience that blends yoga, food, coffee, and fungi culture. Designed as an intimate gathering, it celebrates mushrooms not only as nourishment but as a bridge between wellness, flavor, and community.

🍄 The Concept

This brunch brings together four collaborators—Nuvedo, Maverick & Farmer Coffee, Chef Sejal, and Lisha Sinha, to create a flow where participants can move, learn, taste, and connect. From yoga to mushroom harvesting, live cooking to coffee and conversation, the event is about exploring how mushrooms enrich our lives in unexpected ways.

✨ Facilitators

Nuvedo – India’s functional mushroom brand, cultivating trust, transparency, and fungi-based wellness. Learn more: www.nuvedo.com
Maverick & Farmer – One of India’s few true farm-to-cup coffee brands. With a 140-acre estate in Coorg and a roastery in Bangalore, they produce experimental, award-winning single-estate coffees shipped across India and abroad. Their team, with over a decade of roasting experience, helped pioneer India’s fourth wave of coffee. Learn more: https://www.maverickandfarmer.com/ 
Chef Sejal Agrawal – A vegan, plant-based chef trained at The Vegan School, Goa. Currently a chef at C+C, she also takes on private chef projects, crafting nourishing meals that often give classic non-vegan dishes a vibrant, plant-based twist. Her passion lies in Asian flavors, food R&D, and showing how fun and delicious plant-based eating can be. https://www.instagram.com/chef.sejal/ 
Lisha Sinha – A yoga teacher with over 500 hours of training in Ashtanga, Vinyasa, and Hatha yoga. Lisha integrates breathwork, meditation, and sound in her sessions, inspired by teachers like B.K.S. Iyengar and Sharath Jois. She believes yoga is about presence and resilience, and through her platform Wellness Loop, she creates mindful wellness experiences for individuals and corporates . https://www.instagram.com/lishasinha/ 


📌 Where: Maverick & Farmer Coffee, Gate #3, Gangadhar Chetty Rd, Halasuru, Rukmani Colony, Sivanchetti Gardens, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042 ( https://maps.app.goo.gl/fkCEsqACpZJ3TMEo9 )

📆 Date: September 21st, 2025
⌚ Time: 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM
💰 Cost: INR 1800 + GST (includes all activities and refreshments)
LIMITED SEATS AVAILABLE — Book now to secure your spot!

🔗 REGISTER HERE: https://rzp.io/rzp/Z5kmeRUj 

🗓️ Schedule

9:00 AM – Introduction to functional mushrooms with Nuvedo
9:30 AM – Vinyasa Flow with Lisha Sinha

10:30 AM – Mushroom Brunch

• Live Lion’s Mane mushroom harvest by participants

• Live Cooking with Chef Sejal

• Mushroom-forward vegan menu

• Lion’s Mane Mushroom Coffee with Maverick & Farmer

11:30 AM – Closing circle & reflections

Seats are limited to 20 participants. Reserve your spot to be part of this mindful, flavorful Sunday gathering.With love and spores,

Nuvedo x Maverick & Farmer Coffee with Chef Sejal & Lisha Sinha

name: Soju & Slurp ft. koreatoindia
description:
If you've been waiting to try Korean food in a homely setting, this is your chance! 

Hi, I'm Simran and I run koreatindia (A veg korean supper club). At Soju & Slurp, expect a cozy space where you can chill on a Sunday afternoon, make conversations with new people, relax with soju cocktails and eat to your heart's content. We have a fully curated veg Korean menu that will promise to leave your taste buds tingling for more 💕

name: The Bohra Bohra  Thaal supper club
description:
Street Food Feast Awaits! 🍽️🔥 Dive into the flavors of authentic Mumbai and Bohri delights at The Bohra Bohra Thaal Supper Club! 🤩 Bohri Chicken Farcha, Mutton Raan and  Dum Biryani, Parsi-style Caramel Custard, & more – every bite a burst of tradition and taste! 🍗
Come hungry, wear comfy clothes, and get ready for an unforgettable evening of food, fun, and farmaishi!
Book your spot now and make this supper club experience one to savor!  

Can’t wait to host you!
📅date and 🕰 Time : 
 Sept 21st : 12pm brunch 

Price per seat  : 2900(includes gst )
📍 Jpnagar, Bangalore   
📞 +91 9742661909

name: The Uncertainty Principle (2002) with TPCC
description:
Our meetings consist of a screening of an arthouse film, followed by a discussion. The discussion is led by one of our members or sometimes a guest speaker and encourages members to share their thoughts and interpretations of the film.
Who are The Parallel Cinema Club?

A community-run film society, we are a collective of film enthusiasts who gather weekly to explore the world of cinema, discuss auteurs and themes, and occasionally host guest lectures.

name: Whimsical Wednesday with Improv Lore
description:
Dive into the whimsical world of improvisation at our Wednesday Jams!

Whether you’re a novice to theatre, a maverick on stage, or just dipping your toes into the world of unscripted performance, this Jam is designed for everyone. Our facilitators will guide you through a series of engaging improv exercises, help you explore new characters, and set up scenarios that will make your inner wit shine - all on the spot!

Come as you are, leave your inhibitions at the door, and join us on this journey of endless possibility.

Bring a friend, a date, or a group - our brave space is for everyone!
Who are Improv Lore?

We are Bangalore-based community-theatre troupe, works towards spreading the art of spontaneous storytelling & unscripted stagecraft, and rekindling the joy of being playful & whimsical. We meet on Wednesdays for Jams, and on weekends for workshops.

name: Folding Ninjas with Roligami
description:
Not every gathering needs to be a formal workshop! Casual Fold & Connect Nights are all about relaxed creativity, sharing, and building community through Origami. Whether you’re seeking a new hobby, a meditative practice, or a creative outlet, the Folding Ninjas welcomes you! No prior experience is necessary—just bring your curiosity and enthusiasm.

For All Skill Levels:
Absolute Beginners: Get started with some easy folds!
Intermediate Folders: Refine techniques, learn, and seek help from fellow folders.
Advanced Practitioners: Experiment, teach others, and push creative boundaries.

Meet-Up Structure
-Welcome and Warm-Up (30 minutes)
-Check-in and settle in.
-Ice-breaker activity: A quick origami-related game or fold to get everyone engaged.
-Skill level check-in: Beginners are paired with experienced folders for personalised guidance.

Free-Form Folding (60 minutes)
-No structured instructions, but beginners will receive guidance.
-Bring your own projects or start something new.
-Collaborative and spontaneous folding.
-Free exchange of techniques and ideas.

Show and Share (30 minutes)
-Members showcase their completed projects.
-Constructive feedback and celebration of individual achievements.
-Informal networking and social time.

What to Bring
Beginners: Nothing! All materials are provided.

Experienced Folders:
-Your own specialty papers (optional).
-Any unique tools or templates you’d like to share.
-Completed projects for show and tell.
-Snacks to share (optional).
-Materials Provided
-Variety of origami papers.
-Instructional guides.
-Basic tools (rulers, pencils, paper cutters, glue).

Who is Roligami?

Roli Agrawal, fondly known as Roligami, is a multi-disciplinary designer and passionate craft enthusiast. Inspired by her love for Japanese culture, she has been exploring and teaching origami for over a decade. Her workshops are a celebration of creativity, and her delightful creations highlight the beauty of paper folding.

Embrace the joy of folding and creativity in a warm, welcoming environment!

name: Songwriting Workshop +Performance with Aanchal Bordoloi & Kiteloon
description:
A songwriting workshop led by Aanchal Bordoloi and Kiteloon where they'll go through and facilitate the process of songwriting, followed by short solo sets by the two.

About the artists:

Aanchal Bordoloi a 24 year old Assamese singer-songwriter based in Bangalore with the experience of performing in venues across the country. She has also been a member of The Vienna Songwriter Circle, Austria when she was 16 and has performed in venues there. The Indian Music Diaries Awards had selected her as one of the best debut artists in 2022. Rolling Stone Magazine had listed her debut single, Whiskey Blues as one of the best singles released in 2021, and her debut EP Letters To Bombay as one amongst the top 10 EPs released in 2024.

Sourjyo Sinha, operating under the moniker Kiteloon, is a songwriter-musician based in Kolkata. Hailing from the town of Silchar in Assam, he writes his songs in a myriad of genres, primarily in the languages of English and Sylheti, which he grew up speaking. As part of the bands Whale in the Pond and Dindūn, he has toured extensively around the country, performing at popular venues and festivals like NH7 Weekender, Zomaland, and more. As part of Dindūn, he also won the prestigious Toto Music Award in 2023.

name: Theory of Quantum Computation, Communication & Cryptography - Conf’25
description: TQC 2025, the 20th International Conference on the Theory of Quantum Computation, Communication and Cryptography, is being held at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bengaluru. This annual gathering brings together leading researchers, students, and professionals from around the world to explore the theoretical foundations of quantum information science. Across September 15–19, the conference will feature talks, poster sessions, and discussions on cutting-edge developments in quantum computation, communication, and cryptography, fostering exchange of ideas at the forefront of quantum science and technology.

location.name: Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bengaluru
location.address: Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bengaluru, Bangalore

name: Mizuho India Japan Study Centre
description: The Mizuho India Japan Study Centre (MIJSC) at IIMB will celebrate its eighth Foundation Day, focusing on the theme of India–Japan collaborations in business and sustainability. The event will feature a distinguished lineup of speakers, including Guest of Honour Prof. Tatsuya Terazawa, Chairman & CEO of the Institute of Energy Economics, Japan, who will deliver an address on cooperation in sustainable energy initiatives. The keynote address, titled 'India Japan Business Connects,' will be delivered by Mr. Sandeep Singh, Managing Director of TATA Hitachi Construction Machinery Co. Ltd. The program will commence with a welcome by Prof. Jaideep Sarkar, Chairperson of MIJSC, followed by context-setting by Saideep Rathnam, COO of MIJSC. A video presentation, 'Milestones @ MIJSC,' will showcase the centre's achievements. Prof. U. Dinesh Kumar, IIMB Director In-charge, will also share his perspectives. A key highlight includes the release of new MIJSC publications. The celebration will conclude with a cultural performance—a classical music fusion presented in association with the Indo-Japanese Chamber of Commerce and Industries-Karnataka (IJCCI). The performance will feature renowned artists Hisae Tsuji on Veena, Siddhanth Kalkur on Flute, Poornima Prasad on Veena, and Shamith Kalkur on Mrudanga, symbolizing the cultural synergy between the two nations.

name: Glitch in the Myth
description: Explore the fascinating intersection of ancient stories and modern sensibilities in 'Glitch in the Myth.' This innovative event challenges traditional narratives by introducing unexpected twists, contemporary perspectives, and 'glitches' that force us to re-examine the myths we thought we knew. Held at the Bangalore International Centre, the performance or discussion series delves into how timeless tales from folklore and mythology can be deconstructed and reinterpreted to reflect our current social and cultural realities. The event might feature storytellers, artists, or scholars who disrupt conventional plotlines, question established morals, and give voice to marginalized characters. Imagine a classic epic with a technological bug, a mythological hero facing a modern-day ethical dilemma, or a goddess reclaiming her narrative from a patriarchal lens. 'Glitch in the Myth' is a playground for creative and critical thought, encouraging audiences to think about the power of stories and how they shape our understanding of the world. It's an intellectually stimulating and entertaining experience that breathes new life into old tales, making them more relevant and resonant for a 21st-century audience. This event is perfect for anyone interested in mythology, storytelling, cultural studies, and the art of creative subversion.

name: Big Bangalore Book Fest
description: Lose yourself in aisles of stories, from timeless classics to fresh new tales. The city's biggest book celebration awaits you. Many stories, One destination.

location.name: Bhartiya Mall Of Bengaluru, Thanisandra
location.address: Bhartiya Mall Of Bengaluru, Thanisandra, Bangalore

name: FLO Bazaar
description: Experience Bangalore's most awaited exhibition, the FLO Bazaar 2025. This event brings together over 100+ brands under one roof, offering a curated selection of the finest in fashion, jewellery, lifestyle, and gourmet experiences. Hosted at the luxurious Hotel Conrad Bengaluru, the bazaar provides a platform for designers and brands to showcase their exclusive collections. Visitors can explore a wide array of products, from high-end fashion and accessories to unique lifestyle items and statement jewelry pieces. It is a premier shopping event for those looking to discover new trends and purchase from a diverse range of creative entrepreneurs. The exhibition is a one-day affair, promising a day filled with luxury, style, and discovery. Organized by FLO, the event aims to bring the best of design and craftsmanship to the discerning shoppers of Bangalore. Don't miss the chance to indulge in this grand shopping festival and find exclusive pieces to add to your collection.
